intro: Rhytidophyllum caribaeum, commonly known as the Caribbean scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. Rhytidophyllum caribaeum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing coastal dunes.
